item.title: the story of my design lab @Telenor
Connecting
item.description:
Connecting

What is interaction design? As technology advances, the way we communicate evolves. But it's important not to lose ourselves and focus on enabling natural interactions.

item.title: Apple - Intention

Apple - Intention

Here, simple phrases paired with elegant visuals describe the thoughts and emotions that go into creating each Apple product. Idea : Victor N.Koch Learn more at http://www.apple.com © 2013 Apple inc.

item.title: No title
item.description: I'm confident humans don't get the real meaning of infinity. they think it is something that has no limits, so it is said to be infinite. how far from the truth: something is infinite when it transmutates back into itself. so it is infinite because it has no ends. even imagination has it is limit. consciousness is the closest thing to infinity.

tune in to the sound of light

item.title: Evernote and the Brain: Designing Creativity Workflows - Evernote Blog
item.description:
Evernote and the Brain: Designing Creativity Workflows - Evernote Blog

One of the classic debates for Evernote organization essentially is, 'to tag or not to tag.' From Michael Hyatt to Thomas Honeyman, thousands upon thousands of you have relied on tags as your primary organizational system. But, the power of Evernote is in its flexibility. Tiago Forte offers up a different approach.

item.title: Why Design Matters
item.description:
Why Design Matters

"What we design, designs us back." Join Jason Silva as he freestyles complex systems of society, technology and human existence and discusses the truth and beauty of science in a form of existential jazz. Subscribe now!
